page.title: 08Fideoak Transmission Station
page.content: This CEGB Transmission Station was opened in 1957. It deals with both the 400 000 volt National Grid lines and the local networks at 132 000 volts or less; it covers about 35 acres and is an important centre in the South-West network. Little change is envisaged over the next ten to fifteen years except in the area of technical development. As pieces of equipment wear out they are replaced with modern, electronic designs which are smaller and usually cheaper (unless they have to be specially produced for the system). The new technology is reducing the work load so that there are between five and ten fewer jobs each year. Today the station employs about seventy people, many local. Jobs are management engineering, fault finding, administration, and maintenance.
